Ingredients.5: 1 (12 fl oz) can caffeinated pepper-type soda (such as Dr Pepper®)

Ingredients.12: 2 (16 ounce) cans baked beans with pork

Directions.1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Directions.2: Mix brown sugar, paprika, mustard, and cayenne pepper together in a bowl. Whisk in pepper soda, ketchup, and Worcestershire sauce until brown sugar is dissolved.

Directions.3: Cut 4 slices of bacon into small strips. Cook and stir in a large Dutch oven over medium heat until almost crispy, 3 to 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl, reserving bacon grease.

Directions.4: Stir onion into the bacon grease in the Dutch oven; cook and stir until soft, 3 to 5 minutes. Add garlic; cook and stir for 1 minute. Pour in bourbon, stirring to scrape up browned bits off the bottom with a wooden spoon. Stir bacon strips back in.

Directions.5: Pour brown sugar mixture and baked beans into the Dutch oven. Simmer until beans are heated through, about 15 minutes. Arrange remaining 4 slices of bacon on top of the beans.

Directions.6: Bake in the preheated oven, covered, until beans are bubbly and sauce is syrupy, about 3 hours.
